abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Programmatic
            Financial Sector Adjustment Loan (PFSECAL) for Brazil was
            satisfactory with likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impact  The Bank's
            performance was satisfactory while the borrower performance
            was highly satisfactory, with the Government and the
            implementing agencies highly committed to the overall
            Program.  The final outcome of the Program is dependent on
            additional policy actions contained in the overall program
            matrix, which could contribute to a potential future loan,
            and are expected to materially affect the achievement of the
            overall Program objectives.  Thus the outcome attributed to
            some of the components has not yet fully materialized but is
            expected to do so.  In addition to the lessons from the
            first PFSECAL, it was learned that the success of one loan
            in a programmatic series enhances the probability of success
            of a subsequent loan, with the continuity of key
            representatives of the Government and the Bank as
            instrumental in the quality of the outcome.  With respect to
            the design of programmatic lending, the flexibility in
            postponing policy actions to subsequent operations in the
            series, particularly when the timing of the reforms is
            difficult to predict, does not detract from the substance of
            reforms, but rather increases the likelihood of a successful
            eventual outcome when they are finally implemented.
            Finally, programmatic lending can be a valuable vehicle for
            sustaining dialogue across administrations and maintaining
            the overall momentum of reform.
